pages.text: Since ancient times, rowan has been revered by wizards, witches, alchemists, and other adepts of the arcane arts as a tree through which primal natural magic flows in a cyclic current. $(br)Growing in forests, this tree can be effortlessly harvested and utilized, as its wood serves as a superb conduit for energy. Thus, rowan wood is often unmatched when selecting the base for a wooden (and most resonant) staff.
A mature rowan tree amidst the forest â€“ this is its natural realm.

Using a simple knife, one can strip the bark from rowan logs, revealing the magical properties that make this tree so intriguing to practitioners of the arcane. $(br)This bark can be employed in the crafting of various wooden items (especially staffs), which demand excellent conductivity of magical energy, a trait for which rowan wood is renowned.

On well-grown rowan trees, especially during the warm seasons, branches can be found adorned with clusters of red berries. These fruits are not only delightful in taste and aroma but also possess a myriad of fascinating properties, ready to be harnessed by any skilled herbalist.
